comments.body: Just `dot(a, v[:, i] = w[i] *  v[:, i]` should do here. With broadcasting the simpler form `dot(a, v) = v * w` also works.but may be more confusing.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +947,951 @@    The number `w` is an eigenvalue of `a` if there exists a vector
    `v` such that ``dot(a,v) = w * v``. Thus, the arrays `a`, `w`, and
    `v` satisfy the equations ``dot(a[:,:], v[:,i]) = w[i] * v[:,i]``
    for :math:`i \\in \\{0,...,M-1\\}`.

comments.body:
This can be cleaned up more now that we only support 2.6-2.7 as the comparison can be done as

```
UPLO == b'L'
```

But that cleanup can wait.
